sidebar.title: Getting the required packages
sidebar.para: NOTE: To download the Nuage-PreRelease-DOC-MIBs-OSTACK-VSG-Cloudmgt-4.0* packages, you will need to be allowed to view and download "Tightly Controlled Internal Access" code. If you are not permitted to view such code, this mean you don't have the permissions. To get the permission to access "Tightly Controlled Internal Access" code, contact the ISWS webmaster. The URL is found on the "Contact Web Master" link of the page when you open http://hpntceqtlsprod.rose.rdlabs.hpecorp.net/Index.aspx.

sidebar.title: Upgrading DCN

listitem.para: Copy the new DCN debian packages into the third-party area as as to the areas used for the virtual environment edits.
Run the third-party-import playbook to build the new neutron and dcn-mda virtual environments.
Save the current CMS ID value to dcn_config.yml (see Save the CMS_ID when Upgrading below).
Run configuration-processor and ready-deployment as in the standard deployment scenario.
Run hlm-upgrade. The hlm-upgrade will upgrade the DCN components.

para.emphasis: Upgrading &kw-hos; with or without upgrading DCN

listitem.para: Run hos-init to update the lifecycle manager.
Before starting the upgrade, follow the procedure to copy DCN into the third-party area. Copy the new DCN debian packages into the third-party area.
Before starting the upgrade, run the third-party-import playbook to build the new neutron and "dcn-mda" virtual environments.
Save the current CMS ID value to dcn_config.yml (see the section "Save the cms_id when Upgrading" below).
Run configuration-processor and ready-deployment as in the standard deployment scenario.
Run hlm-upgrade to upgrade HOS. Hlm-upgrade will upgrade the DCN components.

sidebar.title: DCN VSC HA setup
sidebar.para: The DCN VSC should generally be setup in HA as VSC is the controller.
Summary of the steps are as follows:

listitem.para: In the Input model provision a node for hosting primary VSC and another for hosting secondary VSC.
Once the nodes have come up, gather the IPs (service_ips: dcn-vsc-data) for both the VSCs. This can be obtained from helion/my_cloud/info/net_info.yml on the deployer.
Edit dcn_config.yml file to have the correct vsc_active_ip and vsc_passive_ip. Also ensure other paramenters for VSC in dcn_config are correctly populated.
vsc_mgmt_net: HLM (example network mapping)
vsc_data_net: MANAGEMENT (example network mapping)
vsc_image_name: vsc_singledisk (example name of the qcow2 image provided by the 3rd party)
vsc_user_name: admin (example user name)
vsc_user_pass: admin (example password)
vsc_start_delay: 100 (lower bound on seconds we expect VSC VM to take to boot and stabilize, after this we start polling)
vsc_start_timeout: 300 (upper bound on seconds we expect VSC VM to become available, after this we fail the deployment)
Make sure the FQDN for both VSCs are resolvable on all nodes.
Copy example vsc deployment ansible and services to third-party/dcn area.
Copy vsc qcow2 image provided <vsc_image_name>.qcow2 to third-party/dcn/ansible/roles/dcn-vsc/files/ on the lifecycle manager.
Deploy the cloud, including the third-party deployment steps as described above.
Once deployed, you will have a Helion DCN cloud with VSC deployed in HA (primary and secondary).

sidebar.title: Logging
sidebar.para: The DCN VRS, VRS-G and nuage-metadata processes generate additional log files in /var/log/openvswitch. These are:

listitem.para: VRSG:
nuage-housekeeper.log
nuage-rpc.log
nuage-SysMon.log
nuage-service-extension-config.log
VRS - all of the above, plus:
vm-monitor.log
nuage-metadata-agent.log

sidebar.para: These files are under centralized logging control and log rotated.

sidebar.title: Monitoring
sidebar.para: The VRS and VRS-G processes added by DCN are:

listitem.para: nuage-housekeeper
nuage-rpc
nuage-SysMon
nuage-metadata-agent (VRS-only)
vm-monitor (VRS-only)

sidebar.para: Process checks (pid_count) were implemented in Monasca for the above processes.
Ops Console and the Monasca CLI can be used to verify that the DCN processes are up and running. They can be filtered by dimension "SERVICE: dcn".
/var/lib/libvirt/dnsmasq/vagrant-libvirt.conf
